ghostPost.title: Test then deploy from command line
ghostPost.excerpt:
Gatsby sources content from our Ghost CMS. Netlify builds and hosts the final
Gatsby site. Using Netlify's command line tool, we can test the site's locally
and deploy the changed components to production.

Gatsby-CLI - https://www.gatsbyjs.org/docs/gatsby-cli/
Netlify-CLI - https://www.netlify.com/docs/cli/

authors.name: Alex Welcing
authors.bio: Cloud focused tech human disrupting legacy systems. Working on publishing technology for research and legal materials, leveraging the latest in Development Operations for the AI/ML future.

primary_author.bio: Cloud focused tech human disrupting legacy systems. Working on publishing technology for research and legal materials, leveraging the latest in Development Operations for the AI/ML future.

primary_tag.name: CMS

tags.name: Netlify
tags.description: Great way to deploy your application and manage public facing content. Very smart people, going to eventually be a major public player in Web Development, DevOps, and CD/CI.

tags.name: Development
tags.description: Building code. I use whatever we need to get the job done. JavaScript, frameworks, opensource, yada yada.

tags.name: Cloudy
tags.description: Experience deploying cloud first application architecture and workforce platforms across Google Cloud, Microsoft Azure, and others cloud platforms. Interest in AI/ML ethically on the edge, energy efficient compute, and empowering change and access through technology.
tags.meta_description: Talking about deploying content to the cloud! Clean compute, private ML models, and more.
